definition: lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk

sentences.english: Ichthyosaurs and other contemporary viviparous species, by contrast, gave birth to multiple offspring.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，鱼龙和其他现代胎生的物种产下多个幼崽。

sentences.english: Hongyan Chang Fei-ray, fish and dragons written submersible water jump.
sentences.chinese: 鸿雁长飞光不度，鱼龙潜跃水成文。

sentences.english: Entire skeletons of ancient creatures including predators like the saurichthys, pictured, were discovered
sentences.chinese: 完整的古代食肉动物鱼龙化石被发现，有图有真相。

sentences.english: Given these factors, some areas have become a treasury of well-preserved ichthyosaur fossils.
sentences.chinese: 由于这些原因，很多地区都很好的保存了鱼龙的化石。

sentences.english: Cymbospondylus had no dorsal fin and its tail was long like an eel's.
sentences.chinese: 杯椎鱼龙没有背鳍，尾部像鳗鱼一样扁长。

sentences.english: At present Chinese innovation is a mixed bag.
sentences.chinese: 目前中国的创新“鱼龙混杂”。

sentences.english: The dragons and fishes jumbled together - the good and bad people were mixed together.
sentences.chinese: 《鱼龙混杂》是比喻坏人和好人混在一起。

definition: a legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods/see also 蛟龍|蛟龙[jiao1 long2]
palace of the Dragon King at the bottom of the Eastern Sea
Blue Dragon, other name of the Azure Dragon 青龍|青龙 (the seven mansions of the east sky)
to promote (to official position in former times)

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
